definition: to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Production increased steadily. The growth rate was somewhat lower than that of last year.
sentences.chinese: 生产稳定增长，增速比上年有所回落。

sentences.english: There is a three-fold fall in the monthly profit.
sentences.chinese: 每个月的利润都有三倍的回落。

sentences.english: Another Russian trader testified to the price decline of ferromolybdenum.
sentences.chinese: 另一位俄罗斯贸易商证实钼铁价格回落。

sentences.english: ConocoPhillips and Exxon Mobil Corp. retreated with oil prices.
sentences.chinese: 康菲和埃克森美孚公司与石油价格一同回落。

sentences.english: At least prices in America are back to their long-run average compared with rents (see article).
sentences.chinese: 与房租相比，至少美国的房价已回落至长期均匀值。

sentences.english: Chonggao crude oil fell yesterday, the US-led rebound stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 昨日原油冲高回落，带动美豆止跌反弹。

sentences.english: But shareholders realised the dangers, and prices fell back.
sentences.chinese: 然而，持股者意识到了危险的存在，于是股价回落。

sentences.english: Those prices have since fallen, but so has demand.
sentences.chinese: 煤价和油价因此下降了，而市场需求也随之回落。

sentences.english: Oscillation heavyweights also fell, dragged down part of the index.
sentences.chinese: 权重股也振荡回落，部分拖累了指数。

sentences.english: We were expecting them to come down by now and they have not.
sentences.chinese: 我们预期粮价现在应该出现回落，但是没有回落。

sentences.english: We were expecting them to come down by now and they have not.
sentences.chinese: 我们预期粮价现在应该出现回落，但是没有回落。

sentences.english: America's housing-market correction has gone further than most.
sentences.chinese: 美国楼市回落之势最大。

sentences.english: In adulthood, the number of these receptors fell back to an intermediate level.
sentences.chinese: 进入成年期后，受体数量又回落到中等水平。

sentences.english: Energy prices have been coming down this spring as fears of a Middle East blowup fade.
sentences.chinese: 随着对中东动荡爆发的担忧减弱，能源价格呈现回落。

sentences.english: The government hopes to offset this decline with a rapid expansion of affordable housing.
sentences.chinese: 政府希望通过快速增加经济适用房弥补这一回落。

sentences.english: New home starts dropped to 1，000 in the last quarter of last year.
sentences.chinese: 新施工单位在去年第四季回落至只有一千个。

definition: to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to fall/to tumble
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to rise/to go up
to go down/to decline
large fall
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to vibrate/to shake/to shudder
rising trend/upward momentum (e.g. in prices)
(of trains) down (i.e. away from the capital)/(of river boats) to travel downstream/to issue (a document) to lower bureaucratic levels/(of writing on the page) vertical, proceeding from top to bottom
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
short term/short-term
tendency/trend/path
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
